title: Bug 10403 - Project creation should confirm the bin directory can be scrubbed
description: When a user creates a new project for an existing directory structure, we should confirm that the output directory can be deleted then rebuilt. Some users are creating projects and pointing the output folder at a bin directory which contains more than just .class files that can be rebuilt from the available .java files.
OB: When a user creates a new project and selects a bin directory as the output folder, the bin directory is not deleted and rebuilt.
EB: After creating a new project and selecting a bin directory as the output folder, the bin directory should be deleted and rebuilt.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Open the application and navigate to the project creation page. 
2. Choose an existing directory structure for the new project. 
3. Select a bin directory as the output folder. 
4. Complete the project creation process. 
5. Verify that the bin directory is not deleted and rebuilt, but retains its previous content.
